alert.note: Alert for Custer; Northern Rosebud (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 24 at 6:14PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Custer and northern Rosebud Counties through 715 PM MDT... At 612 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms around northwest Custer County and northeast Rosebud County, moving north at 20 mph. These storms have a history of producing small hail and periods of torrential rain. HAZARD...Penny size hail and torrential rain, resulting in localized flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Miles City, Rosebud, Hathaway, Twelve Mile Dam, Rock Springs, Locate, Angela, Moon Creek Ranch, Cartersville, Strawberry Hill Recreation Area and Matthews Recreation Area. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
